choices.D: Service accounts and role-based access control (RBAC)

questions.question_text: When creating a subscription in Cloud Assembly, what are the two types of runnable items available for executing code? (Choose two.)

An administrator creates multiple flavor mappings and names them as follows:
Small:
1. vCenter / Datacenter:datacenter-1 `" cpu = 1, memory = 2 GB
2. AWS-West-1 / us-west-1 = t2.micro
Medium:
1. vCenter / Datacenter:datacenter-1 `" cpu = 2, memory = 4 GB
2. AWS-West-1 / us-west-1 = t2.small
Where would the administrator use those named mappings to allow users to select image sizes? (Choose the best answer.)

discussion.content: Correct answer is C; When you build a cloud template, you pick an available flavor that fits your needs.

Linked answer covers image mappings, which are not flavor mappings as discussed in the question. Correct answer is C: https://docs.vmware.com/en/vRealize-Automation/8.3/Using-and-Managing-Cloud-Assembly/GUID-B3DC68C3-D1AF-4208-9C0B-C3B222B234D5.html

The answer should be A cloud zone 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Aria-Automation/SaaS/Using-Automation-Assembler/GUID-DFD28DFE-C4C6-4A56-BC82-2FEAB6D64E20.html
Correct answer is C
the answer should be flavor mapping :-( C its the most close to that.

Selected Answer: C
C is the only choice that makes sense, as @obeythefist explains

Let's break it down:

A. Cloud zones - No, these are specifically to do with resources
B. Projects - Project is too high level
C. Cloud templates - Yes, when building a cloud template we must determine what flavor mapping will be used
D. Custom forms - These are a component of the cloud template and don't necessarily relate to the flavor mapping

C is the correct choice
. Deployers can then use the Size and Image component profiles on a blueprint to select pre-defined value sets.
When you build a cloud template, you pick an available flavor that fits your needs.

Answer is A

Requests can be monitored on the Resources > Deployments tab. Click the requested item to view the deployment details.

You have the following tabs to navigate:
• Topology: To visualize the deployment structure and resources.
• History: Provisioning events and any events related to actions that you run after the requested item is deployed. If the provisioning process fails, the History tab events help you to troubleshoot failures.
• User Events: To visualize the user's inputs.

Additionally, the Monitor, Alert and Optimize tabs are available when integrated with VMware Aria Operations.

Taken from Aria Automation ICM 8.10 Lesson Book -> Monitoring Deployments section

Selected Answer: A
the correct is A
Indeed correct one is A
Correct answer is A

The correct answer seems to be "A", 

Log onto Cloud Assembly
Click the Deployments tab
Find the failed Deployment
Click the History tab.

The closest fit is "A", Deployments -> History

As a project member, you can review the request details in vRealize Automation Cloud Assembly.

Procedure
To determine if a request failed, click the Deployments tab and locate the deployment card.
Failed deployment card
Failed deployments are indicated on the card.
Review the error message.
For more information, click the deployment name for the deployment details.
On the deployment details page, click the History tab.

Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer: A

questions.question_text:
An administrator is debugging a multi-machine cloud template deployment and the following error occurs: `Customization operation failed. Customization specification with name [vCenter_Windows] was not found.`
Where can the administrator identify the phase of the provisioning lifecycle and the machine for which this error occurred? (Choose the best answer.)
In vRealize Automation Cloud Assembly, what can administrators use Onboarding Plans to do? (Choose the best answer.)

choices.B: View a list of virtual machines that have not yet been data-collected from a public cloud account.
choices.D: Identify virtual machines that have been data-collected from a configured cloud account but are not yet managed by vRealize Automation.
choices.C: Identify virtual machines that were deployed using vRealize Automation.
choices.A: Find the best cloud template to match to discovered virtual machines.

discussion.content: D is correct
Correct answer is D

Selected Answer: D
D seems definitely correct. The linked article explicitly mentions it should be used for machines that *are* data collected but not yet managed by VRA.
